steps.description: A certain required amount of PGMA@PAH dispersion solution was suspended in 3 mL pristine as-synthesized AuNP solution
The PGMA@PAH@AuNP composites were collected after centrifugation

equipment.name: IKA- RCT DIGITAL Basic Magnetic Hot Plate Stirrer
equipment.instrument_vendor: Chemglass Life Sciences, Vineland, NJ, USA

synthesis.notes: To study the pH effect on the gold nanoparticle coverage, the PGMA@PAH dispersion solution was prepared by combining 10 mL of purified PGMA spheres with 1 mL of 0.5% (w/v) PAH solution followed by three centrifugation/wash cycles. The centrifuged PGMA@PAH sphere precipitates were then dispersed in 11 mL Nanopure water with different pHs (pH <sup>¼</sup> 3, 7 and 11). The raspberry-like PGMA@PAH@AuNP composites were formed by adding 60 mL of PGMA@PAH dispersion to 3 mL of the as-synthesized AuNP solution.
